For the past 25 years, the Bill of Rights Institute has worked to create meaningful partnerships and outreach opportunities to advance civic and history education. Part of that work has included working with legal organizations whose members share a deep commitment to civics and constitutional principles. BRI was proud to support the ABOTA Foundation's recent 2024 Civics Summit. The American Board of Trial Advocates (ABOTA) is a national organization of trial lawyers dedicated to equal justice in a vibrant and civil democracy. To learn more about our partnerships with legal organizations, visit  https://lnkd.in/eYuZPdQK.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #civiceducation

At BRI, we are proud to partner with organizations like Huddle Up. Huddle Up is a leading advocate for children's growth, development, and mental health. As a sponsor of MyImpact Challenge, Huddle Up aligns with BRI's commitment to supporting communities and fostering the wellbeing of kids and teens. This year's MyImpact Challenge received over 20 mental health projects. Here are a few: Anjani Sharma, from Westshore High School in Rockledge, Florida, founded the global non-profit Minds Without B0rders  to raise awareness and promote mental health literacy and causes. Focused on storytelling, Minds Without B0rders has engaged 2,000 youth and generated 9,000 stories shared, 700 resources translated, and 5k social media followers. Anya Kawlekar, from Robbinsville High School in New Jersey, founded Mental Health Awareness in Young Athletes (MHAYA) to raise awareness of mental health issues in youth sports. And Jack Finder from San Juan Hills High School in California, authored and distributed the childrens book Mommy and Daddy Still Love Me  for children of parents going through divorce. To read more about MyImpact Challenge, visit  https://lnkd.in/gagj58zD And to learn more about our exciting partnership with Huddle Up, visit  https://lnkd.in/eata2HEf  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #mentalhealthawareness

Some of the most talented civics and history students in America traveled to Philadelphia and Washington, D. C., earlier this month to explore civics, democracy, and Americas unique story. The week was the capstone event for the Bill of Rights Institutes elite Student Fellowship program, a six-month educational program that helps high school students develop as leaders and develop skills in building civil society. The Student Fellows enjoyed a robust itinerary in Philadelphia and Washington, D. C., during their trip. Each day incorporated specific themes, including leadership and the roles of government, the individual, and the entrepreneur in civil society. To learn more about the fellowship, visit  https://lnkd.in/gm59gU3W.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #StudentFellowship

Benjamin Franklin and Abraham Lincoln have a new home at the Bill of Rights Institute – thanks to the generosity of Print & Graphic Communications Association in support of the Power of the Printed Word Initiative! The Print & Graphic Communications Association, which represents the printing and graphics industry for New York state, New Jersey, Pennsylvania and Delaware, recently donated a more than 100-year-old bust of Franklin and a 125-year-old piece of stone lithography artwork depicting Lincoln to BRIs headquarters. To read more about their generous donations, visit  https://lnkd.in/ee2NUT42. The Power of the Printed Word Initiative ensures every student has access to a pocket Constitution, fostering a generation of informed and engaged citizens. Interested in supporting? Visit  https://lnkd.in/eE-zWeup or connect with Justin Goldstein, CAE for more information!  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #PowerofthePrintedWord

We had the opportunity to catch up with Caroline Gao, the Grand Prize winner of BRI's 2023 MyImpact Challenge civic engagement contest. Listen to Caroline describe her nonprofit, The World in Us, a youth-to-youth cultural education organization, and the ways in which MyImpact Challenge helped her to connect concepts like citizenship skills and civic virtues to her work. These are foundational skills and ways of thinking that I dont think I would have internalized nearly as much as I have now if not for the MyImpact Challenge,  Gao said.  https://lnkd.in/ebyqpN3X.
